children.definition: Comprehensive security grant covering personal property, equipment, inventory, receivables, IP, and equity interests. Standard in PC market (74.1% EDGAR, 100% DealData).
children.name: Substantially All Assets

children.definition: Targeted security approach limited to specific asset classes such as pledged stock and debt instruments of the issuer.
children.name: Asset-Specific Security
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 67 (Unknown); KCT Cat 1 Item 2

children.definition: KCT cat4.12 requires the protective mechanism 'negative pledge coverage' but it is not adequately represented in the ontology.
children.name: negative pledge coverage
Credit Basis for Unsecured
children.definition: Unsecured structure has negative pledge coverage and the credit basis for unsecured lending.
No collateral requirements. Credit-based or cash flow lending without asset pledge.
children.name: Unsecured

children.definition: Tangible personal property pledged as collateral: inventory (raw materials, WIP, finished goods), equipment, fixtures, and leased assets.
children.name: Physical Assets

children.definition: Financial instruments pledged as collateral: accounts receivable, letter of credit rights, chattel paper, deposit accounts, securities accounts, and general intangibles.
children.name: Financial Assets

children.definition: IP assets pledged as collateral: patents, copyrights, trademarks, trade secrets, and licenses. Exclusion is especially risky for asset-light businesses.
children.name: Intellectual Property
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 1 Item 2; LME Provision Language, Restrictions on Material Intellectual Property or Other Asset Leakage to Unsubs (J.Crew)

children.definition: Pledged equity interests in subsidiaries: 100% stock of domestic subs, 65% of first-tier foreign subs (tax-driven limitation under IRC Section 956).
children.name: Equity Pledges

children.definition: Defines the breadth of assets pledged as security. Substantially all assets is standard in PC market (100% per DealData; 74.1% in EDGAR corpus). Determines what lenders can liquidate in enforcement. Neutron extraction context (COLL_SCOPE): Scope of collateral package including asset types, excluded assets, and overall coverage. Should be "all assets" of U.S. loan parties with standard exceptions.

extraction_refs.difficulty_note: Aligned from ontology=easy vs playbook=hard (playbook authority for extraction complexity)

COLL_SCOPE.label: Collateral - Scope
exactPhrases: Note any unusual aspects of collateral/guaranty structure
all assets of U.S. loan parties with standard exceptions
Note any unusual aspects of collateral/guaranty structure
all assets of U.S. loan parties with standard exceptions

COLL_SCOPE.label: Collateral - Scope
COLL_SCOPE.description: Scope of collateral package including asset types, excluded assets, and overall coverage. Should be "all assets" of U.S. loan parties with standard exceptions.
COLL_SCOPE.backgroundExplanation: Collateral/guarantee scope should be "all assets" of U.S. loan parties with standard exceptions. Sources emphasize Sungard conditionality: UCC filings and stock certificates of borrower (and sometimes subs if readily deliverable) at close; other perfection steps (e.g., account control, mortgages, USPTO filings, foreign assets) move to post-closing covenants unless essential to the credit. The collateral package is fundamental credit support and directly impacts recovery in a workout scenario.
COLL_SCOPE.summary_used: Scope of collateral package including asset types, excluded assets, and overall coverage. Should be "all assets" of U.S. loan parties with standard exceptions.

children.name: Collateral Scope

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Limited to stock pledge and material assets; excluded assets carve-outs for non-assignable permits, immaterial leasehold, foreign assets
key_negotiation_axes: scope: substantially_all vs asset_specific vs stock_pledge_only
real_property: included_with_threshold vs excluded
ip_pledge: all_ip vs material_ip_only vs excluded
deposit_accounts: control_agreements_required vs springing
perfection_timeline: closing vs post_closing_30d vs post_closing_60d vs post_closing_90d
after_acquired_property: automatic vs best_efforts vs not_required
foreign_assets: 65pct_first_tier vs excluded_entirely
excluded_asset_scope: narrow vs broad vs expansive
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: First priority perfected lien on substantially all assets of Borrower and Guarantors; all personal property, real property (subject to threshold), IP, equity interests

children.definition: Real property below FMV threshold ($1.5M-$7M) excluded from mortgage requirements. Higher thresholds in UMM. LMM: $1.5M, CMM: $2.5M, Geneva: excluded entirely.
children.name: Real Estate Thresholds

children.definition: Stock of first-tier foreign subsidiaries exceeding 65% excluded for tax reasons (IRC Section 956 deemed repatriation). CFC/FSHCO considerations apply.
children.name: Foreign Subsidiary Stock >65%

children.definition: Equity of subsidiaries below materiality thresholds (2.5% individual / 5% aggregate of total assets or revenue) excluded from pledge requirements.
children.name: Immaterial Subsidiary Equity

children.definition: Real property classified as principal property excluded due to mortgage cost. Primarily relevant for industrial/manufacturing borrowers with significant owned real estate.
children.name: Principal Properties

children.definition: Specific IP categories excluded from pledge: intent-to-use trademark applications (legal requirement), certain license agreements with anti-assignment clauses, software with third-party restrictions.
children.name: Certain Intellectual Property

children.definition: Deposit accounts below de minimis threshold ($250K-$5M individual/aggregate) excluded from DACA requirements.
children.name: Deposit Accounts Under Threshold

children.definition: Payroll accounts (79.3% excluded), tax withholding accounts (65.5% excluded), zero balance/sweep accounts (58.6% excluded). Essential operations accommodation.
children.name: Operational Accounts

children.definition: Low-value assets where perfection cost exceeds recovery value. Title-registration assets excluded as impracticable to perfect via certificate filing.
children.name: Motor Vehicles / Consumer Goods

children.definition: Assets excluded from the collateral pledge because third-party contractual agreements prohibit their assignment or encumbrance. Includes JV interests with transfer restrictions, franchise agreements with assignment prohibitions, and acquired assets subject to anti-pledge covenants. The 'not in contemplation' qualifier limits abuse by preventing borrowers from deliberately creating contractual restrictions to shield assets from the collateral package.
children.name: Contractual Restrictions

children.definition: Assets carved out from the security grant for operational, regulatory, tax, or cost-benefit reasons. Each exclusion creates a gap in collateral coverage that reduces lender recovery in enforcement.
children.name: Excluded Assets

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Limited to stock pledge and material assets; excluded assets carve-outs for non-assignable permits, immaterial leasehold, foreign assets
key_negotiation_axes: scope: substantially_all vs asset_specific vs stock_pledge_only
real_property: included_with_threshold vs excluded
ip_pledge: all_ip vs material_ip_only vs excluded
deposit_accounts: control_agreements_required vs springing
perfection_timeline: closing vs post_closing_30d vs post_closing_60d vs post_closing_90d
after_acquired_property: automatic vs best_efforts vs not_required
foreign_assets: 65pct_first_tier vs excluded_entirely
excluded_asset_scope: narrow vs broad vs expansive
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: First priority perfected lien on substantially all assets of Borrower and Guarantors; all personal property, real property (subject to threshold), IP, equity interests

children.definition: Initial UCC-1 financing statement filings required at closing. Covers all personal property in jurisdiction of organization. Continuation statements required every 5 years. [1): No immediate Event of Default for loss of lien or priority due to a carve-out broader than loss of possessory collateral or UCC continuation filing fa]
children.name: UCC Filings

children.definition: Tri-party agreements providing lender control over deposit accounts (DACAs), securities accounts, and commodity accounts.
children.name: Control Agreements

children.definition: Dollar threshold above which commercial tort claims must be identified by written notice and added to the collateral package through a supplement to the security agreement. Below the threshold, such claims are excluded from the perfection requirements, recognizing the administrative burden of tracking and perfecting security interests in individual litigation claims.
children.name: Commercial Tort Claims

children.definition: Dollar threshold above which negotiable instruments (promissory notes, drafts) held by the borrower must be delivered to the collateral agent for perfection by possession. Instruments below the threshold are perfected solely by the UCC filing, accepting a lower level of perfection security for immaterial instrument holdings.
children.name: Instruments

children.definition: Dollar threshold above which chattel paper (records evidencing both a monetary obligation and a security interest or lease) must be delivered to the collateral agent for perfection by possession or control. Below the threshold, filing-only perfection is accepted, trading perfection certainty for administrative efficiency on low-value chattel paper portfolios.
children.name: Chattel Paper

children.definition: Dollar threshold above which promissory notes held by the borrower must be endorsed and delivered to the collateral agent for perfection by possession under UCC Article 9. Notes below the threshold remain perfected by the blanket UCC-1 filing, accepting the subordination risk to a holder in due course for immaterial note holdings.
children.name: Promissory Notes

children.definition: Materiality standards for physical delivery of possessory collateral. Dollar thresholds below which instruments, chattel paper, and promissory notes need not be delivered.
children.name: Delivery Thresholds

children.definition: USPTO/USCO filing requirements for perfection of IP security interests. Not limited by materiality, exclusive copyright licenses, periodic after-acquired timing.
children.name: IP Filing Requirements

children.definition: Timing for delivery of stock certificates representing pledged equity. At closing, 45-day, promptly, 30-day.
children.name: Stock Certificate Delivery

children.definition: Real property mortgage/deed of trust filing requirements for owned properties exceeding FMV threshold. Includes title insurance, surveys, and environmental assessments.
children.name: Mortgage Requirements

children.definition: Categories of collateral where perfection is not required: assets in jurisdictions where filing is impracticable, assets with de minimis value, after-acquired assets within grace period.
children.name: Perfection Exceptions

children.definition: Steps required to establish and maintain priority security interests beyond initial UCC filing. Covers delivery of possessory collateral, control agreements, IP filings, and real property mortgages. Neutron extraction context (COLL_PERFECTION): Perfection requirements for security interests including UCC filings, pledges, control agreements, and other perfection steps. Under "Sungard" conditionality, require borrower/holdings stock pledges at closing and if any carveouts are included; UCCs are baseline. Consider IP filings for material portfolios, post-closing foreign collateral, and whether DACAs are required initially or post-closing.

COLL_POST_CLOSING.label: Collateral - Post-Closing Requirements
exactPhrases: post-closing covenants unless essential to the credit
within [30/60/90] days after the Closing Date
post-closing covenants unless essential to the credit
within [30/60/90] days after the Closing Date

COLL_PERFECTION.label: Collateral - Perfection Requirements
COLL_PERFECTION.description: Perfection requirements for security interests including UCC filings, pledges, control agreements, and other perfection steps.
COLL_PERFECTION.backgroundExplanation: Under "Sungard" conditionality, require borrower/holdings stock pledges at closing and if any carveouts are included; UCCs are baseline. Consider IP filings for material portfolios, post-closing foreign collateral, and whether DACAs are required initially or post-closing. Sources emphasize that UCC filings and stock certificates of borrower (and sometimes subs if readily deliverable) should be delivered at close; other perfection steps (e.g., account control, mortgages, USPTO filings, foreign assets) move to post-closing covenants unless essential to the credit.
COLL_PERFECTION.summary_used: Perfection requirements for security interests including UCC filings, pledges, control agreements, and other perfection steps. Under "Sungard" conditionality, require borrower/holdings stock pledges at closing and if any carveouts are included; UCCs are baseline. Consider IP filings for material portfolios, post-closing foreign collateral, and whether DACAs are required initially or post-closing.

children.name: Perfection Requirements

negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: First priority perfected lien on substantially all assets of Borrower and Guarantors; all personal property, real property (subject to threshold), IP, equity interests

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 67 (Security); KCT Cat 5 Item 1; Review Template Row 39 (Collateral and Guarantors); Review Template Row 154 (Closing Deliverables)

children.definition: Automatic collateral release when asset sold or disposed of pursuant to the disposition covenant. Most common release trigger. Proceeds subject to mandatory prepayment / reinvestment rights.
children.name: Release on Permitted Disposition

children.definition: Guarantee and collateral released when subsidiary designated unrestricted. Subject to Chewy blocker preventing IP trapdoor and J.Crew preventing material asset stripping.
children.name: Release on Unrestricted Sub Designation

children.definition: KCT cat4.4 requires the protective mechanism 'admin agent authority scope' but it is not adequately represented in the ontology.
children.name: admin agent authority scope
Release Mechanism (Auto vs. Discretionary)
children.definition: Permitted lien collateral release involves admin agent authority and release mechanism (automatic vs. discretionary).
Collateral agent releases or subordinates lien to accommodate permitted liens with priority status (e.g., purchase money liens, capital lease liens, ABL facility liens).
children.name: Release for Permitted Lien Priority
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 4 Item 4; KCT Cat 4 Item 10; KCT Cat 5 Item 1

children.definition: Collateral released upon satisfaction of defeasance conditions: deposit of sufficient funds, no EoD, legal opinion of tax neutrality. Rare in leveraged finance.
children.name: Covenant Defeasance Release

children.definition: Anti-value-stripping protections preventing collateral release: requires bona fide business purpose, bars release if entity holds material IP (J.Crew) or if minority sale is to affiliate (Chewy).
children.name: Chewy / J.Crew Release Blocker

children.definition: Conditions under which collateral is automatically released from the security interest. Each release pathway creates potential value leakage if not properly constrained by Chewy/J.Crew protections.
children.name: Collateral Release Mechanics

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Limited to stock pledge and material assets; excluded assets carve-outs for non-assignable permits, immaterial leasehold, foreign assets
key_negotiation_axes: scope: substantially_all vs asset_specific vs stock_pledge_only
real_property: included_with_threshold vs excluded
ip_pledge: all_ip vs material_ip_only vs excluded

excluded_asset_scope: narrow vs broad vs expansive
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: First priority perfected lien on substantially all assets of Borrower and Guarantors; all personal property, real property (subject to threshold), IP, equity interests

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 52 (Collateral); Review Template Row 40 (Collateral/Guarantor release)

children.definition: Equal-priority sharing arrangements between creditors with same-ranking liens. Ratable sharing of collateral proceeds in enforcement. Standard for revolving + term loan structures.
children.name: Pari Passu Sharing

children.definition: KCT cat4.4 requires the protective mechanism 'permitted creditor carve-outs' but it is not adequately represented in the ontology.
children.name: permitted creditor carve-outs
Standstill Period Duration
children.definition: Lien subordination includes permitted creditor carve-outs and standstill mechanics.
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 2 Item 1; Learning Material: STANDSTILL PERIOD

children.definition: Junior lien agreements where second-lien creditors accept lower priority on shared collateral. Standstill periods (90-180 days typical) limit junior creditor enforcement.

market_benchmarks.prevalence_of_agent_directed_ica_authori: [cat4.11] KCT cat4.11 requires prevalence/severity data for 'prevalence of agent-directed ICA authority' but no existing node provides this benchmark.
market_benchmarks.prevalence_of_agent_directed_subordinati: [cat4.4] KCT cat4.4 requires prevalence/severity data for 'prevalence of agent-directed subordination' but no existing node provides this benchmark.
market_benchmarks.required_lender_vote_rates_for_ica: [cat4.11] KCT cat4.11 requires prevalence/severity data for 'required lender vote rates for ICA' but no existing node provides this benchmark.
market_benchmarks.sacred_rights_coverage_of_lien_subordina: [cat4.4] KCT cat4.4 requires prevalence/severity data for 'sacred rights coverage of lien subordination' but no existing node provides this benchmark.

children.name: Lien Subordination Arrangements
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 4 Item 4; KCT Cat 4 Item 10; KCT Cat 4 Item 11

children.definition: Provision preserving each creditor class's right to assert claims against the borrower and guarantors notwithstanding the waterfall priority. Ensures that payment priority in the ABL/term loan waterfall does not constitute a waiver of underlying debt obligations. Prevents subordination arguments based solely on collateral priority allocation.
children.name: Reservation Of Obligations
Collateral Allocation Split
children.definition: ABL/Term waterfall includes reservation of obligations and the collateral allocation split.

Split-collateral intercreditor agreement: ABL has priority on current assets (receivables, inventory), term loan has priority on fixed assets (equipment, IP, equity). Each silent on other's collateral.

market_benchmarks.abl_intercreditor_agreement_prevalence: [cat4.10] KCT cat4.10 requires prevalence/severity data for 'ABL intercreditor agreement prevalence' but no existing node provides this benchmark.
market_benchmarks.typical_ica_types: [cat4.10] KCT cat4.10 requires prevalence/severity data for 'typical ICA types' but no existing node provides this benchmark.

children.name: ABL / Term Loan Waterfall
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 8 (Term Loan); DLS Preferred Row 21 (Term Loan Margin); DLS Preferred Row 30 (Term Loan); KCT Cat 4 Item 10; Review Template Row 129 (Events of Default); Review Template Row 154 (Closing Deliverables)

children.definition: KCT cat4.11 requires the protective mechanism 'sacred rights protection against forced ICA' but it is not adequately represented in the ontology.
children.name: sacred rights protection against forced ICA
Enforcement Rights Waiver Scope
children.definition: Silent second lien includes sacred rights protection and enforcement waiver mechanics.
children.definition_source: Review Template Row 149 (Unknown); KCT Cat 2 Item 1

children.definition: Second-lien position with no independent enforcement rights. Junior creditor waives right to object to foreclosure, DIP financing, use of cash collateral. Maximum subordination.
children.name: Silent Second Lien
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 4 Item 4; KCT Cat 4 Item 10; KCT Cat 4 Item 11; Review Template Row 162 (Agency Fee)

children.definition: Contractual priority order for distribution of collateral proceeds in enforcement: (1) first-lien secured claims, (2) second-lien secured claims, (3) unsecured claims, (4) equity.
children.name: Proceeds Distribution Waterfall

children.definition: Arrangements governing relative priority, sharing, and enforcement rights between creditors with security interests in the same collateral. DLS Preferred row 9 (Accordion) notes: 'To the extent the Credit Facility provides the ability to incur junior lien or unsecured debt, thought must be given to maturity date and mandatory prepayment terms.' DLS Preferred row 80 (Liens) alternative includes 'liens securing refinancing indebtedness; provided no up-tiering of debt is permitted.' KCT Category 4 item 11 flags: 'Language requiring the Admin Agent to enter into intercreditor agreements in respect of any permitted debt without a Required Lender vote (which could be read to require subordination to any and all permitted debt) or without having negotiated a form of intercreditor in advance.' PC Term Comparison Second Lien section directs: 'Anti-layering: avoid 1.5 lien and require any debt contractually subordinated to 1L to also be to 2L.'
children.name: Intercreditor Provisions

negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: First priority perfected lien on substantially all assets of Borrower and Guarantors; all personal property, real property (subject to threshold), IP, equity interests

children.definition_source: KCT Category 4 item 11 (intercreditor without Required Lender vote risk); DLS Preferred rows 9, 80 (intercreditor in incremental and lien contexts); PC Term Comparison Second Lien section (anti-layering)

children.definition: Flood insurance requirements that spring into effect when mortgaged property is in a FEMA-designated special flood hazard area. Federal regulation mandates compliance.
children.name: Springing Flood Insurance

children.definition: Deposit account control agreements that activate from 'notice' to 'control' status upon occurrence of a trigger event (typically default or default + grace period expiry).
children.name: Springing DACA Control

children.definition: Mortgage filing requirements that activate when real property value exceeds FMV threshold. Allows operational flexibility below threshold while ensuring coverage above.
children.name: Springing Mortgage Requirements

children.definition: Collateral-related obligations that activate upon occurrence of specified triggers, typically crossing a dollar threshold or upon certain events. Defers compliance burden until material.
children.name: Springing Obligations

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Limited to stock pledge and material assets; excluded assets carve-outs for non-assignable permits, immaterial leasehold, foreign assets
key_negotiation_axes: scope: substantially_all vs asset_specific vs stock_pledge_only
real_property: included_with_threshold vs excluded
ip_pledge: all_ip vs material_ip_only vs excluded

after_acquired_property: automatic vs best_efforts vs not_required
foreign_assets: 65pct_first_tier vs excluded_entirely
excluded_asset_scope: narrow vs broad vs expansive
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: First priority perfected lien on substantially all assets of Borrower and Guarantors; all personal property, real property (subject to threshold), IP, equity interests

children.definition: UCC blanket lien automatically attaches to after-acquired personal property. Additional actions required for real property (mortgages), IP (filings), and equity (certificate delivery).
children.name: After-Acquired Collateral Sweep

children.definition: Newly formed or acquired subsidiaries that qualify as loan parties must execute joinder agreements and pledge assets. Timing typically 30-60 days after formation/acquisition.
children.name: Subsidiary Joinder Requirements

children.definition: Compliance certificate disclosures of newly acquired assets requiring perfection: new IP registrations (19.5% periodic), new commercial tort claims, new deposit accounts.
children.name: Periodic Collateral Updates

children.definition: Obligations to bring newly acquired or created assets into the collateral package. Prevents the collateral pool from shrinking as old assets are disposed of and new ones acquired.
children.name: After-Acquired Property

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: 120d for first audit; going-concern for maturity/covenant ok; 60d for first 3 quarters; no monthlies; no forecasts or 90-120d; no lender calls or choose between MD&A/calls; reporting limited to Borrower + restricted subs
hot_button_items: (xvii) covenant to guarantee obligations and give security
key_negotiation_axes: annual_financial_deadline: 90d vs 120d_first_year
audit_opinion_qualification: clean_only vs going_concern_maturity_ok vs going_concern_covenant_ok
quarterly_financial_deadline: 45d vs 60d_first_3Q
monthly_financials: required vs not_required
monthly_forecasts: required vs not_required vs 90d_forecasts
lender_calls: quarterly vs annual vs not_required
mda: with_financials vs not_required
compliance_certificate: quarterly vs annual
guarantee_security_covenant: affirmative_covenant vs best_efforts
further_assurances: required vs not_required
interest_rate_protection: required vs not_required
entity_scope: holdings_and_all_subs vs borrower_and_restricted_subs
inspection_frequency: unlimited_with_cost_cap vs annual_plus_eod
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: 24 enumerated covenants: annual (90d, audited, clean opinion), quarterly (45d), monthly (30d), monthly forecasts, quarterly lender calls, MD&A, compliance certs, notices, tax/existence/property/insurance/ERISA/environmental, inspection rights, guarantee/security covenant, further assurances, IP, interest rate protection, FCPA/OFAC/Patriot Act

children.definition: Standard tax-driven exclusion: only 65% of voting stock of first-tier foreign subsidiaries pledged to avoid deemed repatriation under IRC Section 956. Does not apply to non-voting stock.
children.name: 65% Stock Pledge Limitation

children.definition: Foreign Subsidiary Holding Company treated as CFC for pledge purposes. Equity of FSHCO capped at 65% to avoid deemed repatriation of earnings of underlying foreign subs.
children.name: FSHCO Treatment

children.definition: Foreign jurisdiction-specific perfection requirements: share register entries, notarization, apostille, local filings. Post-closing accommodation typical (60-90 day deadline).
children.name: Local Law Perfection

children.definition: Limitations and special treatment for security interests in foreign assets. Driven by tax efficiency (65% stock pledge cap), local law perfection requirements, and practical enforcement challenges.
children.name: Foreign Collateral

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Limited to stock pledge and material assets; excluded assets carve-outs for non-assignable permits, immaterial leasehold, foreign assets
key_negotiation_axes: scope: substantially_all vs asset_specific vs stock_pledge_only
real_property: included_with_threshold vs excluded
ip_pledge: all_ip vs material_ip_only vs excluded
deposit_accounts: control_agreements_required vs springing
perfection_timeline: closing vs post_closing_30d vs post_closing_60d vs post_closing_90d
after_acquired_property: automatic vs best_efforts vs not_required
foreign_assets: 65pct_first_tier vs excluded_entirely
excluded_asset_scope: narrow vs broad vs expansive
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: First priority perfected lien on substantially all assets of Borrower and Guarantors; all personal property, real property (subject to threshold), IP, equity interests

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 52 (Collateral); Review Template Row 39 (Collateral and Guarantors)

children.definition: Whether DACAs are required, optional, or conditional. Universal in PC market per DealData.
children.name: DACA Requirements

children.definition: Excluded from DACA requirements. Essential operations accommodation.
children.name: Payroll Accounts

children.definition: Tax withholding and trust fund accounts excluded from DACA. 65.5% exclude. Regulatory compliance facilitation.
children.name: Tax Withholding Accounts

children.definition: Zero balance accounts that sweep daily to a controlled master account. 58.6% excluded. Administrative efficiency  controlled indirectly via master account DACA.
children.name: Zero Balance / Sweep Accounts

children.definition: Dollar threshold below which accounts exempt from DACA. $250K-$5M individual/aggregate.
children.name: De Minimis Threshold
children.definition_source: Review Template Row 99 (Unknown); KCT Cat 1 Item 3

children.definition: Account categories excluded from DACA requirements for operational necessity.
children.name: DACA Exceptions

children.definition: Deadline for execution and delivery of DACAs. 60-day standard, 90-day, at closing, 30-day.
children.name: Delivery Timing

children.definition: Tri-party agreements providing lender control over borrower deposit accounts. Essential for cash management and ECF sweep enforcement.
children.name: Deposit Account Control Agreements

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Limited to stock pledge and material assets; excluded assets carve-outs for non-assignable permits, immaterial leasehold, foreign assets
key_negotiation_axes: scope: substantially_all vs asset_specific vs stock_pledge_only
real_property: included_with_threshold vs excluded
ip_pledge: all_ip vs material_ip_only vs excluded
deposit_accounts: control_agreements_required vs springing
perfection_timeline: closing vs post_closing_30d vs post_closing_60d vs post_closing_90d
after_acquired_property: automatic vs best_efforts vs not_required
foreign_assets: 65pct_first_tier vs excluded_entirely
excluded_asset_scope: narrow vs broad vs expansive
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: First priority perfected lien on substantially all assets of Borrower and Guarantors; all personal property, real property (subject to threshold), IP, equity interests

children.name: Required Locations
children.definition: Criteria for which leased locations require landlord lien waivers or bailee letters  typically locations holding inventory or equipment above a threshold value, or all locations with material assets.
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 1 Item 2; PC Term Comparison: 1. Key Definitions - Required Lenders

children.name: Agreement Form Requirements
children.definition: Required content of landlord waivers and bailee agreements  waiver of landlord's lien, agent access rights for inspection and removal, notice periods, and form approval (agent-approved vs. borrower's form).

children.name: Delivery Timing Deadline
children.definition: When landlord/bailee agreements must be delivered  at closing (for material locations), within 60-90 days post-closing, or on a commercially reasonable efforts basis without hard deadline.

children.name: Consequences of Non-Delivery
children.definition: Remedies when landlord/bailee agreements cannot be obtained  exclusion from borrowing base, increased reserve, reporting obligation, or no consequence if best efforts were used.
Collateral access arrangements for leased premises. Not required, headquarters only, threshold-based. Ensures lender can access and remove collateral from leased locations.
children.name: Landlord / Bailee Agreements
Irrevocable Proxy Grant
children.definition: Grant of irrevocable proxy to the administrative agent to vote pledged equity interests upon an Event of Default, enabling the agent to exercise governance control over subsidiary entities.

children.name: Issuer Acknowledgement
children.definition: Written acknowledgement from the issuer of pledged equity that it recognizes the security interest and will comply with agent instructions regarding transfers, distributions, and voting upon enforcement.

children.name: Pre-EoD Voting Rights Retention
children.definition: Borrower's retained right to vote pledged equity and receive distributions prior to an Event of Default, with the proxy becoming effective only upon default  the standard pre-enforcement arrangement.
children.definition_source: Review Template Row 131 (Unknown); KCT Cat 1 Item 1

children.definition: Enhanced control over pledged equity beyond certificate possession. Proxies required, not required. Enables agent to vote pledged stock in enforcement.

extraction_refs.difficulty_note: Aligned from ontology=easy vs playbook=hard (playbook authority for extraction complexity)

market_benchmarks.prevalence: medium -- common in equity pledge collateral packages
market_benchmarks.typical_requirement: irrevocable proxy in favor of agent

children.name: Proxies / Issuer Acknowledgements
Dollar Threshold Levels
children.definition: Fixed dollar thresholds for collateral-related defaults, tiered by deal size  LMM ($1.5M-$3M), CMM ($2M-$5M), UMM ($17M or 10-15% of EBITDA)  below which collateral impairment is not actionable.

children.name: EBITDA-Scaled Thresholds
children.definition: Thresholds expressed as a percentage of EBITDA or total assets rather than fixed dollars, providing automatic scaling as the borrower grows and preventing technical defaults on de minimis collateral gaps.

children.name: Grace & Cure Periods
children.definition: Time permitted to cure a collateral-related default after notice  typically 15-30 days for perfection failures, 5 days for insurance lapses  before the default becomes an actionable Event of Default.
Materiality thresholds for collateral-related Events of Default. No threshold, dollar threshold, combined, agent carve-outs. Loss-of-lien EoD range: $1.5M-$17M.
children.name: Collateral Default Thresholds
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 90 (Events of Default); Review Template Row 129 (Events of Default)

children.definition: Grower baskets that increase excluded asset thresholds as EBITDA grows. Dollar-pegged exclusions may become immaterial relative to growing enterprise value.
children.name: Basket Expansion Mechanics

children.definition: Borrower reclassifies assets from included to excluded categories (e.g., reclassifying a domestic sub as immaterial). Must be tested against objective financial tests.
children.name: Asset Reclassification
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 1 Item 1; PC Term Comparison: 1. Key Definitions - Asset Sales:

children.definition: Borrower ability to expand excluded asset categories over time through basket resizing, definition amendments, or reclassification. Monitored via compliance certificate disclosures and annual collateral audits.
children.name: Excluded Collateral Creep

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Limited to stock pledge and material assets; excluded assets carve-outs for non-assignable permits, immaterial leasehold, foreign assets
key_negotiation_axes: scope: substantially_all vs asset_specific vs stock_pledge_only
real_property: included_with_threshold vs excluded
ip_pledge: all_ip vs material_ip_only vs excluded
deposit_accounts: control_agreements_required vs springing
perfection_timeline: closing vs post_closing_30d vs post_closing_60d vs post_closing_90d
after_acquired_property: automatic vs best_efforts vs not_required
foreign_assets: 65pct_first_tier vs excluded_entirely
excluded_asset_scope: narrow vs broad vs expansive
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: First priority perfected lien on substantially all assets of Borrower and Guarantors; all personal property, real property (subject to threshold), IP, equity interests

children.name: Certain Funds Period
children.definition: The window during which SunGard limited conditionality applies  from signing of acquisition agreement through closing  during which only specified conditions precedent may block funding.

children.name: Specified Representations Scope
children.definition: The narrow subset of representations (typically 10-12 of 34) that must be true at funding under SunGard conditionality  organization, authority, no-conflict, enforceability, solvency, PATRIOT Act, and OFAC.
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 57 (Unknown); Review Template Row 150 (Unknown); KCT Cat 1 Item 3

children.name: MAE Exclusion Scope
children.definition: Carve-outs from the Material Adverse Effect definition under SunGard conditionality  typically industry-wide changes, general economic conditions, changes in law, and effects of the transaction itself  narrowing what can block closing.

children.name: No-Default Testing Scope
children.definition: Under SunGard conditionality, which defaults block funding  typically limited to payment defaults and bankruptcy EoDs, excluding financial covenant breaches and other non-payment defaults during the certain-funds period.

Framework for closing-day collateral perfection limiting what must be perfected at closing versus post-closing. Review Template row 39: 'Under Sungard, require borrower/holdings stock pledges at closing and if any carveouts are included; UCCs are baseline. Consider IP filings for material portfolios, post-closing foreign collateral, and whether DACAs are required initially or post-closing.' Learning Material section on Conditions Precedent covers the SunGard certain funds framework where specified collateral delivery is a closing condition while most perfection steps are deferred to post-closing covenants. This framework balances closing certainty (sponsor can close the acquisition) against lender protection (core collateral secured on day one).

market_benchmarks.standard: limited conditions precedent per SunGard framework

children.name: Sungard Conditionality
children.definition_source: Review Template row 39 (Sungard collateral: stock pledges + UCCs at closing; IP/DACAs/foreign assets post-closing); Learning Material section on Conditions Precedent (certain funds framework)

children.name: Perfection Failure Scope
children.definition: Which perfection failures constitute a potential Event of Default  UCC filing lapses, failure to deliver stock certificates, missed mortgage recordings  and whether only material liens are covered.

children.name: Materiality Filter
children.definition: Threshold requirement that the perfection failure affect a material portion of collateral before triggering an EoD, preventing technical defaults from minor filing errors or immaterial asset categories.

children.name: Grace Period After Notice
children.definition: Cure period  typically 30 days after notice from the administrative agent  to remedy a lien perfection failure before it matures into an Event of Default, with possible extension for diligent pursuit.
Event of Default trigger for loss of lien priority or perfection. Determines whether collateral impairment is immediately actionable.

market_benchmarks.prevalence: medium -- failure to perfect as EoD subject to materiality

children.name: Lien Perfection Eod
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 52 (Collateral); Review Template Row 39 (Collateral and Guarantors)

definition: Security interests granted to lenders covering substantially all assets of U.S. loan parties with customary exceptions, perfection requirements, and release mechanics. Review Template row 39 (Collateral and Guarantors): 'Collateral/guarantee scope should be "all assets" of U.S. loan parties with standard exceptions. Sources emphasize Sungard conditionality: UCC filings and stock certificates of borrower (and sometimes subs if readily deliverable) at close; other perfection steps (e.g., account control, mortgages, USPTO filings, foreign assets) move to post-closing covenants unless essential to the credit.' DLS Preferred row 78 affirmative covenants clauses (xvii) 'covenant to guarantee obligations and give security' and (xix) 'further assurances as to security' (both highlighted) establish the ongoing obligation to maintain and expand the collateral package.
name: Collateral Package
definition_source: Review Template row 39 (all-assets scope with standard exceptions, Sungard conditionality); DLS Preferred row 78 clauses (xvii) and (xix) (highlighted: guarantee/security covenant and further assurances)
